Hagarath the Subjugator is disgusted with his colleagues attempts at army building. He will not build a force of mouldy undead! No, he shall subjugate the mighty beasts of the lands! To this end, this vicious, cruel human has come to this region and has hunted and broken the dinosaurs to build a vast reptilian horde. The greatest of his carnivorous thralls is now his favourite, bloodthirsty mount!

Orgoth Smashface is the bad tempered, belligerent big boss of the Orcs that have moved into this region. He, like most Orcs, since the Battle of the Zogrom War Party vs the Shroud Host, HATES the Shroud forces and likes nothing better than giving them a good duffing up. With so many Shroud lieutenants in the area, it shouldn't come as a surprise that Orcs have moved to attack them. The only problem is, you've defeated the Shroud troops already, meaning you MUST be worth fighting and Orgoth Smashface, infuse with the power of Luz Turgoz, is coming for you!

Death Worms come in many shapes, colours and sizes but all are deadly predators. Ganaroth Death Worms are toothless but can shoot out a violet stream of powerful acid that will burn right through all but the strongest of armor. Occasionally, one of these creatures will reach truly gargantuan proportions, posing a threat to all but the largest of prey creatures.

The Pandarite Kraken Spawn that haunt these desolate shores are not true kraken. They are far to small to be actual Kraken but they are still the largest predator on the Pandarite Coast. These vast monsters hunt and devour anything that crosses their path, Glapperclaws, people, other kraken spawn, all is fair game for these voracious predators!

Varunaga is an ancient and malevolent being. Why she has risen from the deep, bringing other horrors with her is not known. What is known is that she is controlling these creatures and is using the Hornarac Demoness' as lieutenants. She seems to have a similar form as the Demoness', just incredibly old and considerably more powerful!

The Shroud Huntress is stalking these lands and is likely responsible for the Lokat Shadow Tigers and Shroud Bats. She shares their billowing, insubstantial forms though she is humanoid and female. She's quite obviously of the Shroud as well as, like many of the Shadow Lord's minions, her face is replaced with a single cyclopean eye!

The Kethnoir High Priest of the Moon Elves of this enclave has been seduced and corrupted by Darkness. He has subtly and carefully altered his sermons and, in turn, corrupted his faithful flock. Now the Moon Elves are filled with righteous fury at the injustices perpetrated against their mighty Shadow Lord. The High Priest has grown in power to the point that dark magic literally bleeds from his very pores.

The Fae Queen has ruled her subjects since time immemorial. She has been a fair and just ruler but recent events have hardened her and resulted in her people becoming more aggressive. This is likely down to the destruction visited upon the Pellranor Forest. If such destruction could so suddenly overtake her Dryad allies, they could do the same here, if her people are unprepared. While her motives may be pure, her methods are not. She must be made to see reason!

Iron Back is a vast Grey Back Bear that claims the largest hunting grounds in the Rotarian Canyon. This titanic bear stalks and kills anything that crosses his path, whether he is hungry or not. He charges down his prey, usually knocking his prey into the air, then crushes the unfortunate beneath his vast bulk before messily tearing them apart.

Where the Kaindarite Minotaur came from, much less how it was demonically possessed is anyones guess. All that is whispered by those few who survive encounters with the monster is that it wields a colossal flail which it swings with the ease bourne of demonically augmented strength.

The Snorg Abomination appears to be the secret weapon of this invasion. Like a colossal mix of the Snorgor and the Snorulpa with an added dash of ugly and power, this monstrosity will require more that fine arms and horses as the Royal Guard and Mounted Legionnaires have discovered to their violent and bloody cost!

The Spiridus Leader is the cheeky chappy that convinced the other Winter Spiridus to pinch the Christmas Pig to get the villagers to play with them. He means no harm He just wants everyone to have fun!

The Killantzaroi have gone and nicked every part of the blessing bowl! They've hidden the pieces so they can try and get up to mischief! The Chief has kept the Basil. You'll have to liberate it from him!

Ignatus Monstrom is a fire Demon, summoned up by Dwarves who knew not with what they were meddling. The Demon swiftly destroyed the impudent Dwarves and claimed their fortress for himself. He's been building his power since, drawing more demons and fire aligned creatures under his banner.

The Telarathian Lord Corruptor is an Elvish Mage of uncommon power. His abilities allow him to corrupt others to his own ends, whether it be to enrage his own people beyond sense, (a gift reserved for spies and traitors) or to twist other races into fighting on his behalf.

The Grefflian Enslaver is a vile demonic force that has enslaved not just the humans of the Keep but also the invading ratmen. Where it came from, no one knows. All it seems to want is it's own small empire of playthings which the humans and ratmen will supply! He is the source of the green energy flowing out of the enslaved eyes.

The Chieftain of the Multuubo tribe is a powerful Warrior and charismatic leader. He leads his people fairly and is a ferocious foe to those who threaten his people. He wields his tribal spear and shield with speed and grace, a fearsome warrior!

Thagagror The Deathly is a Necromancer of uncommon power. This magus of undeath is raising an army of the dead. There is a deeper darkness around him, leading you to believe that he is a minion to someone, or something greater...

Kolandarus the Enflamed is a vast fire daemon of significant power. It has not been seen in many years and to find it here, with an army of loyal dwarves is a shock. Even more so is that the fire of it's body is exuding shroud energy as well as heat and smoke!

The Shroud Warlord is second in command of the Shroud forces in Daranoth Fortress. His mastery of warfare is the reason for his appointment in this position. To whom he reports is still a mystery however...

The Halfling Master Thief has gathered this band of desperate Halflings together to both keep them safe but also to train them for hit and run attacks against any outsiders who appear in their Realms!
The Yannamare Savannah Lion is an alpha predator upon the plains. Fast and powerful, these superb hunters are readily be able to take down even the largest of Giant Ground Sloths!
The Ice Druid Elder has corrupted the Ice Druids of the Nalrath Wastes. What he has them worshiping and to what end is a mystery.

The Gargantuan Ice Serpent has grown to it's titanic size through unknown means. There's no doubting the size and power of the monster however. It may have been brought into being by the magical energy in the Realms and the intense, bitter cold merging and somehow creating this vast beast!

The Felnat Temple Guardian is the most proficient warrior of the Felnat Islands. This Warrior is has ascended to the role of the Guardian of the Felnat Temple. He likes testing his mettle against any all all comers.
Vantiock Bone Construct is a vast monster that's creation is shrouded in mystery. This massive creature is a magically formed golem constructed for all the random bones all around this boneyard!

The Odelia Broodmother spawns the Odelia Christmas Spiderlings that inhabit the area. For some reason, unknown to all in the region, she has become aggressive, unwilling to allow anyone near her or her spawn. This bears investigation!

The vicious Volfango Wolf Alpha has led his pack to this area in search of fresh prey. Having no fear of man has resulted in them setting up a den in this area! This gigantic white wolf is waiting for his pack to drag prey back to his den!

Exalted Moroi have become fully flesh and are at full strength, more than capable at taking on the strongest of warriors and winning. The Exalted Moroi serve their father well, reaping in a constant flow of prisoners for him to feed upon, for a Moroi without food will quickly return to its weak blur form.

The Jabari Chief Karama is a fair and honourable woman. She rules her tribe well and looks after her people with a ferocious passion. She is also a mighty warrior and the most straight forward way to earn her respect is to defeat her in honourable combat.

Pirate Queen Moxie rules over the pirate gangs of the Gellaroth Coast with an iron fist. She takes a cut of all pirate's swag and none resist this any more. Those who used to mete a grisly end as Moxie is a great warrior and decidedly vengeful! She ought to be treated with respect or, better yet, avoided all together!

The Hakulaq are sinuous, mermaid-like creatures. They differ from the usual mer-folk however, as Hakulaq are half eel and quite hideous to look upon. The Alpha is an even larger, more hideous creature. It can use it's thick tail to constrict and crush smaller ships so that it, and it's kin can feed upon the morsels within.

The Ice Men that wander the ice fields of Wiranage were created by a magical ice mage. However when the mage finally succumbed to old age the Ice Men stayed animated and began wandering all over the land on random paths of destruction. The greatest of these are the vast Wiranage Ice Man Juggernauts!

Master of the frozen legion that infest this area, the Rentagoth Skeletal Warlord is a warrior of unparalleled skill. None of it's ability has been lost due to something as irrelevant as death! Clad is excellent armour and wielding an excellent frost blade, the Warlord has been the end of many a foolish warrior who,  in turn, join it's legions.
Kulock is the God of the Kroba. The Avatar is a statue of Kulock, consecrated in the blood of the Kroba's enemies and unleashed to bring ruination to all before it!

Capcauns are huge brutish creatures that dwell in caves in the area. The Capucun are ogre sized beings with snarling dog like faces that carry clubs which they squash their prey with. The Capucaun are addicted to eating humans and if the scent of man is in the air they will travel long distances to find and devour the unfortunate person. The Capcaun Hound is the Alpha of a pack. Huge, powerful, these great beasts can keep even the Bruisers under control.
This vile Wraith has been infusing the local dead with considerable power and hatred. They have been rising and attacking all living being. The destruction of this fiend is paramount!
Goroloth Tower Lord rules his tower with an iron fist! Who can topple him?
The Onarath Lizard Kings are vast, desert dwelling giants. Vaguely similar to Horned Lizard, these monsters have grown to gargantuan sizes and are lethal predators!
Lord Garan lead the Janonat Dark Horsemen in life and has continued to do so in death. A master swordsman in life, being dead has not slowed him in the slightest!

Dinosauroid Carnosaurs are the big war beasts used by the Dinosauroids. The living engines of destruction will rampage through the enemy and take a heck of a lot of effort and lives lost to bring down!
In this clear area, a Colossal Vorgid has grown and is protecting it's territory aggressively.
The Werepanda Savage is a lycanthrope who has spent to long in his beastial form. The animal has taken complete and savage control. It needs to be put down!
This crazed Sorcerer is the mastermind (in his mind anyway) who created the Possessed Puppets. His motive? He no longer knows. He just keeps creating them.
The Pirate Lord has gathered the surviving Pirates and forms a bastion to protect themselves against the various Nerathon monstrosities!
The Black Hound is a particularly strong ghost that haunts Churchfence. It is said that his howl is a sure and guaranteed sign of your impending death!
The  Anima Fire Hounds are gigantic dogs with teeth of fire. They are said to have been mortals who have offended the Gods and been transformed!
Sepharom Blade Lords are the Leader caste of Sepharom warrior. These fighters can wield a blade so well that it has become instinctive. A truly feared opponent.
The Hemovore Blood High Shaman can speak directly to their foul god Aok Tonrar and through the means of ritual blood magic, they can bring forth powerful spells to destroy their enemies.
A gigantic ape-like beast that resides deep within the Sendath Swamps. This beast is fiercely protective of its territory.
The Warlord of Ornatag is a mighty warrior of great stature and strength. He Is also ruthless and heartless. He must be destroyed.

The Boolagor Owlbear Sages are great creatures. These beings are said to one with nature and are in touch with natural magics that flow through the world. They are as wise as an Elven scholar and can control magic - using it against enemies of their kindred if they must. The Great Owlbears often gather in covens where they discuss the secrets of the universe.

The Bodach is a demonic creature that dwell deep within the forests. The Bodach exists in a state of flux and constantly shifts in and out of reality in a blur. this makes the demon a dangerous foe as trying to land a blow on a being that is often not there can be difficult indeed. The exalted Bodach  is a much more powerful version of these vile creatures!

These jungles are home to the Kalador Sabertooth Cat. These predatory felines are masters of the stealth attack. Leaping from the undergrowth onto their prey, they sink their sword like teeth into the neck for an instant kill. Their queen is a vastly powerful yet disturbingly stealthy monster. She is the most capable hunter in the jungle!

Carrion Hounds are horrific beasts to look upon. Often these Hounds become desperate for food and will actually attack something they feel they can kill themselves. The most powerful of these become hulking monsters that'll attack anything that crosses their path!

The most malevolent of the Vantaria Knockers, the King is a savage and evil creature. Rewarding his minions for their most horrendous deeds especially if they are committed on those who dare trespass in the burrows.
The Zylath High Lord has been planning the defense against the plague of undeath, however, his people do not know he brought this nightmare upon them as a sacrifice to a dark power!

A refinement of the Shadow Mithril Shield Golem on a massive scale, the Shadow Mithril Bulwark Golem is well named! A massive defensive creature formed of tempered and purified Shadow Mithril, this golem is a perfect defense against the worst that can be thrown against the Tananath Fortress!

The Hoaragog Ice Roc is a vast terror which haunts the mountains and glaciers of Hoaragog. This gargantuan monstrosity hunts and devours anything it comes across and those not eaten are returned to the Rocs nest, to be torn into bloody morsels for the Rocs young!

The Janath Drow Essence Vore is a corrupted and debased elf, more beast than thinking being. The twisted energies have creating a monster that subsists on the life force of any creature unfortunate enough to be in the same area as it.

The Lowland Stalker is a strange carnivorous reptilian beast. It is thought that these creatures were once members of the Denagar Troglodytes that live below the tundra but have been corrupted by the foul magics that saturate these lands into something more bestial and primitive. The Exterminator is a much larger, far more aggressive breed of the beast!
The Desiccated Kraken Corpse was washed up and has crawled around, crushed and devouring anything that crosses it's disgusting path!

Little is known of the creatures known as Lobsteroids. Appearances of these beasts appear from time to time in sailor's tales and many suspect that the Lobsteroids are the worshippers of a vengeful sea god that controls the waters or that they cause the hazardous seas in the area themselves with magic. The Overlord is a massive specimen that seems to lead larger swarms!

Hom Tanks, the Engine Supervisor, is a demonic creature with a deep-seated loathing of children. This comes to a head at Yuletime, when the little creatures are so happy and cheerful. He will put a stop to this frivolity.
The Crank is an infamous demon with a hatred of Yule Tide and it's material trappings. He sends out Scant Hounds with orders to steal all gifts and ornaments, determined to ruin everyone's fun!

Living in the darkness of the frozen caves for millennia has made the Neitori albino and blind. These large insects feel and sense their way around the darkness for food, quickly snatching at anything that comes into their grasp with their serrated mantis like claws. The largest of their kind, the Behemoth, is a titanic monster of vast strength.

The nocturnal Moon Elves were once peaceful and tranquil but something changed and they became a violent hateful people, attacking anyone who enters their domain. The change appears to be related to a mysterious cult that has spread through their society. The Priestess leads this cult and shows no sign of giving up her power!
This ancient cavern necromancer has hidden here for many, many years. This self enforced isolation has driven him quite, quite mad.
Locked in the frozen dungeons of the castle, the Liche has been imbued with the power of the clear ice that encases her wretched form!
In this clear area, a Colossal Vorgid has grown and is protecting it's territory aggressively.
The more the Fen Leeches feed, the greater they can and do grow. This gargantuan example has grown to a titanic size, draining large creatures in mere minutes!

The Great Horned Gouger is a species of gigantic goat. It is about the size of a fully grown bull cow and the males have an even fiercer temperament. The Greater Horned Gouger is the most fearsome of their kind. Bigger, with a more majestic crown of horns.

Giant Fiddler crabs swarm the Beaches in these parts. Although the smaller type are normally scavengers, the bigger, meaner variations are very aggressive and will tear potential prey apart! The gigantic Gnarled Carapace type is bigger and much heavier armored!

The Seonaidh are a Fay folk that dwell in and around these dark waters. These creatures are driven into a frenzy by the sight of man for they crave human ale, for they lack the skills to make alcohol themselves. The Seonaidh will mindlessly savage any human in sight in an attempt to find any of this precious liquid. The Lords of these creatures drink the greatest quantity and quality of stolen booze.
These trolls are as thick as the snow around them, though no less dangerous for it! They are lead by a fearsome Chief who rules through strength and a base form of cunning.
The Monatis Stone Lord is an animated statue of gigantic size and is a mighty warrior. He has been secluded in this copse for aeons, kept apart thanks to his loyal Guardians.

The Bheur are a caste of Warrior Fay that seek to prove themselves in battle against foes who would see themselves more mighty than them. At around three foot high these diminutive warriors are not to be taken lightly and they can easily best even the most powerful of foes with their razor sharp Faymore Swords. The Lords have proven themselves time and again and seek ever more powerful foes to test their mettle!
The Venarian Elf Lord rules the city with an iron fist!

The Fillyoo are semi intelligent reptile men that live in the caves. They have poor eyesight so they seek out their prey using a long sensitive tongue like snakes do. Once their prey have been detected they act upon it, lashing out and killing the victim with a venomous bite. The Rex is a bigger, stronger with a much more refined hunting ability. The venom of it's bite is considerably more potent. A subterranean threat of huge proportions.

The Saragath Smith Lord has been guiding his people for hundreds of years and for most of that, he's been steadfast and mighty. With the attack of this orc clan, the crack of centuries of pressure are showing. He is directing his troops in a haphazard way but his loyal warriors refuse to gainsay him.

The orc clans in distant lands send out fast moving raiding parties to gather and steal weapons and other rare items to fuel their own tribes wealth. These roving packs of raiders are led by Raider Lords. These ferocious raider are mounted on the most aggressive wolves and take savage joy in running down prey for loot and meat!

Grandmother Yaga is an evil, withered old crone who likes nothing better than spreading misery and undoing the good works of the man she hates the most, Edd Zorom. Edd Zorom is a man known as being supremely kind to everyone, particularly children, giving them gifts with the help of his Granddaughter. This infuriates Grandmother Yaga and she'll stop at nothing to defeat him and cast a pall over the festive season.
The Ice Crusted Treeman awoke due to fell magics which twisted his once noble soul. Enraged, his madness infecting the Dryads, he has gone on the rampage and, sadly, must be felled.

This demon operates like a form of Succubus, she casts her spells that send human or beast into a kind of day dream. The enchanted souls then experience their deepest desires and the most wonderous pleasures. To the outsider it appears that the affected person has gone mad, eating mud and filth when the victim believes they are eating a delicious banquet, talking to animals as though they talk back, but of course they really don't. There's no cure and the demented eventually die from exhaustion, it is very upsetting to the victims family and friends, but absolutely hilarious to the Demons who seem to grow stronger with this small amount of Chaos. The Queen draws greater strength and afflicts more powerful vision on her victims!
The Ornithak Plains Lord is the greatest horse woman in the tribe. She is all but unstoppable when on horseback!
Garanok Moleman Overseer bellows at his men, trying to ensure that explosives are in the best place to destroy the city above!
Guilder Juggernaut is a vast war machine created by the Dwarf Guilders to protect their interests and lay siege to the city of Garanok. It must be destroyed.

The Balarath Corpse Golems are formed by the bodies of those that the Will o' the Wisps have lured to their doom. The fell necromantic energies of the marsh meld them into towering engines of undead flesh!

The Guardians of the wood normally attack those who are harming their domain. But Elementals draw most of their strength from the wood itself. The decaying forest is making these peaceful creatures attack anyone who now enters the Forest. They are fearful that any more damage would lead to the final destruction of the wood and themselves. The Treemen are greater in power but the ravaging has eroded their minds to a devastating degree.

Kulock  is the warrior God of the frogmen of the various jungle they inhabit. This bellowing, belligerent being is unforgiving of those not showing enough spine and has been known to imbue statues in his honor with a portion of his power. These golems will march forth and punish all believed to lack a proper warrior's fire.
The mighty Danathor Grove Lord is a huge Treeman, roused from his slumber by recent attacks in the forest. He marches out to deal with all invaders, regardless of innocence.

Kentarak the Ice Liche is a vile being. He has been locked in the depths of the glacier for time beyond memory. Already unhinged, he is now utterly mad. He slays all who encroach in his realm and reanimates them as undead, which he talks to in his madness. He must be destroyed.
The massive Skorpinok Emperor is an enormous, armored example of it's kind. It is not above fighting for itself, deflecting blows on it's heavy carapace and crushing it's enemies in it's huge claws.

The Jastenor Geomancer is an unhinged madman. He is responsible for both the Choking Sand and Sandoid. He created them yet lost control, allowing them to roam the immediate area. They're not threat to him, just everyone else. He needs to be stopped before he created more unholy creations!

Giant Eltanath Crocodiles are so huge and impressive that the few crazy natives in the area worship them as gods and feed them live food as offerings. The greatest example of these monstrous reptiles is the Gargantuan Eltanath Crocodile. These creatures have grown to vast proportions and are muscle clad engines of destruction and death.

Known only as the Gillmen these monstrous aquatic creatures dwell in the deepest parts of the swamp where they spend time submerged in mires and lagoons waiting for prey to wander their way before dragging them into the filth to be devoured. The Greater Gillmen are monstrous creatures, wrestling even the largest foe into a watery grave.

The Magma Lion are large feline creatures that live close to the lava pits and prey upon the foolish that come here. These big cats are covered in black fur and have glorious red manes that surround their snarling faces. The Greater Magma Lion is a huge example of this species. Girded in muscle and all but impervious to fire, they are a hunters dream trophy! However, these big cats often end the careers of such hunters in screams and welters of blood.
These hulking brutes ensure that Santork's Workshop runs as smoothly as any place can when crewed by greenskins and slaves. They rule with an iron fist and a few grunted words.

Created by unsuspecting children from the ensorcelled snow conjured up by the malicious Snow Imps, these demonic snowmen are rampaging through the area. They've been getting larger as they gather more snow into themselves. They need to be destroyed before Santork ends up with an army of Colossal Snowmen!

The local tribes of Ghouls live in Galanoth Forest. The Ghouls are primitive creatures and worship what they consider an evil god of death that resides in a nearby grove. In reality, the creature is a vast, corpulent Ghoul King, which rules through fear and violence.

The Drac Celestial Oracle uses the mechanisms of it's kin to scry the heavens, searching for some meaning, known only to the universe. What it's searching for cannot be good for any that's not of the Drac!

The Farillion Corallian Overlord rules his people with an iron grip. Any who trespass upon his lands are dealt with savagely. Any who survive to face him face a hulking being of stone and coral, wielding a vast blade grown from his own coral "flesh".

The Einherjar are warriors whos skills in combat far outstretch those of mere mortals. These lone warriors are said to have transcended death and been brought back from the afterlife so they may once again fight and hone their skills. Some Einherjar are said to have left the path of becoming better warriors and have become debased, seeking new ways to torturer and maim their victims rather than outright kill them in combat.
Many suspect the Ithnar Liche is behind the risen dead of the graveyards. How it managed to sneak through the town to it's lair is anyone's guess, but it must be put down!
In this clear area, a Colossal Vorgid has grown and is protecting its territory aggressively.
The Kruxgor is a beast that wishes revenge on all creatures who would dare hunt it's kind to the brink of extinction. Unfortunately these beasts have gone mad and become to much of a danger.

Dusk Goblin Riders ride huge Cave lizards that have naturally sharp claws which grip the rock floor of the underground Passages. The lizards have a poisonous saliva that paralyses it's victims, leaving the Dusk Goblin Rider with an easy prey. The Warlord is mounted on the largest, most vicious of their kind, as befits his own temperament.

Thornvine Dryad Warwitch is a much more powerful type of Thornvine Dryad. Unlike their sisters, they are rarer though they make up for this with a staggering grasp of natural woodland magic and an incandescent rage which dwarfs even their sisters anger over the damage done to the local woods.

Capcauns are huge brutish creatures that dwell in caves in the area. The Capcaun are ogre sized beings with snarling dog like faces that carry clubs which they squash their prey with. The Capcaun are addicted to eating humans and if the scent of man is in the air they will travel long distances to find and devour the unfortunate person. The Capcaun Hound is the Alpha of a pack. Huge, powerful, these great beasts can keep even the Bruisers under control.

Uruns are a peaceable race that have lived most of their lives within the bounds of their own lands. Travellers describe them as kind. Offering sanctuary to those who really need it, and are renowned for their vast knowledge of the stars.rnIt appears that the Shadowlord's minions have seeded their evil here too. The Urun have grown increasingly aggressive towards each other. Their lands are now rife with internal conflict.rnThe Zeranuth Chieftain is driving her warriors into battle with their neighbours. Why she is doing this is anyone's guess but you MUST find out before all are destroyed by her xenophobic rampages.

King Iiroe has long been a beloved and righteous ruler. That changed with the arrival of the Shadow Chancellor. Where it came from, no one knows. All they did know is it handed out tokens and has had the King's ear ever since, twisting this noble ruler to it's own ends.
A villainous aristocrat that has imprisoned the denizens of the Winterbell Wood. His high taxes and non-festive ways have brought nothing but misery to the world!
The Elves believe that this beast is a herald of all that is good in Nature and that it is crafted by the very hand of Light, to show all who see it that there is always hope.
In this clear area, a Colossal Vorgid has grown and is protecting it's territory aggressively.
The Summoner has knowledge of necromancy and demonology. Not enough to be a serious threat, but more than enough to cause trouble for all nearby!

The Dark Sultan is a cruel individual, believing he is owed more in this life and has decided to take it by force. With his sorcerers empowering his new terracotta army, he now feels it's time to expand his lands. He must be stopped.

Jonas was the son of a blacksmith who resided within the city. Jonas was born deformed and his father hid him away from the public the best he could but one day he was discovered and was cast out by the city. He was forced into hiding within the maze-like sewers, learning quickly how to survive in this dangerous environment and soon becoming bestial like the creatures he hunted, with his last traces of human being only the hatred of those who shunned him as a child.

Hypeezles are large weasel type creatures that live deep in the forest. Hypeezles are noted for their insane savagery in a fight and refusal to back down from even the most suicidal conflict. The Brood Mother is as frenzied as her litter spawn. She fights in a flurry of bites and claws, with a speed that surprises, given her bloated body!

Renagar Corallian Warmasters are formed by the reefs in the direst of attacks. These hulking examples are the reef's vengeance made manifest. Towering over their opponents in combat, just striking these monsters can be dangerous with their bodies being home to many plants and animals considered dangerous to humans!
A guardian of the Weaver strides across the Reef constantly searching for anything that can sate its eternal hunger.

The Polarweres are native to this cold land. They are foul-tempered beasts that are part-man but their reason and mind have been consumed by the spirit of the polar bear. The Polarwere Alphas are even more fearsome than their lesser kin, easily outfighting the local Trolls and making a messy meal of them.

Hypeezles are large weasel type creatures that live deep in the forest. Hypeezles are noted for their insane savagery in a fight and refusal to back down from even the most suicidal conflict. The Brood Mother is as frenzied as her litter spawn. She fights in a flurry of bites and claws, with a speed that surprises, given her bloated body!

When Erii McWoody created his machine to turn snow into food, he did not foresee the chaos that would ensue. Enchanted by an overflow of magic, McWoody's house transformed into this gingerbread abomination that, caked in far-too-much confectionaries, can barely stand.

The Vendaro Scorpion Brood Mother is a vast, armored arachnid with massive, crushing claws and a spear-like stinger that can run an armored knight through without needing to resort to the monstrously potent venom it carries.
Lord Thaden is a dark warlord, pledged to the Shadow Lords' cause. He's led his warriors to the Ketoric Fortress to further some abominable plan, You must destroy him and his forces!
The Sorcerer appears to be controlling their lesser brothers though they themselves are more than likely being used themselves.

A powerful mage in life Merrick received two gifts from the Shadow Lord himself, a spell book and a stave. With these two potent artefacts, Merrick claimed the Town of Tiranok for his own kingdom. He then turned his own necromancy on himself thus becoming a powerful Lich and gaining even more control over his undead minions.

The Gray Hag Queen is a powerful witch that is in charge of The Gray Hags sisterhood. The Queen controls the actions of the sisterhood and its targets. The Queen is an ancient, crumbling being that has lived for centuries.

Thornvine Dryad Warwitch is a much more powerful type of Thornvine Dryad. Unlike their sisters, they are rarer though they make up for this with a staggering grasp of natural woodland magic and an incandescent rage which dwarfs even their sisters anger over the damage done to the local woods.

It is unknown where this weird creature came from. What is known is that it eats all it can find. Travellers speak of an odd slurping sound, and when they investigate strange gurgle in the dark, they find themselves fighting for their very lives. The greatest of these goo cubes can reach vast sizes and consume larger prey animals like horses with frightening speed.

Plains Trolls are large gangly beasts, unlike much like any other Troll type that tend to look well fed. These Trolls are more cunning and bold in their actions as it lives in a land where food is scarce and there is little terrain for the Troll to hide in ambush so it must make bold open attacks on its prey. The fastest of their kind are the most successful hunters and leaders of their small tribes.

Weeping Swampman are almost humanoid beings that shamble through the swamp. They resemble nothing much more than a large mass of rotting swamp plants, roots and mud. These Swampmen make crying noises and their eyes glow with an unearthly light. Local legends say these beings are fuelled by the souls of those who die lost in the fens and as a result have magical powers that can slow its prey from escaping its deadly grasp.

Yeti are huge, bad-tempered beasts and their shamans are so foul-tempered that they are generally exiled from the Yeti community. In the Wilderness, these angry beasts use their abilities to create magical ice crystals that are used in rituals to the Yeti Ice God Faryl who will send powerful ice storms and blizzards to freeze to death any who dare offend the Shaman.

A large half-man, half-wolf demon from the Hell of Ice. Long ago he was summoned to Erildath through a contract with a powerful sorcerer. When the contract expired, he ate both the heart and soul of the sorcerer and sought to take over the Howling Grove. He was stopped by three brothers, all demon hunters, who sealed him in the Howling Depths. A thousand years has weakened the magic of his seal, and he longs to continue his conquest.

The Cold Rusalki are malicious beings linked magically to the frozen ice that makes up their glacier homes. The Cold Rusalki despise anyone who would dare enter their domain uninvited and delight in freezing their enemies with icy blasts or impaling them upon icicles that erupt from their domains. Some Cold Rusalki are said to be powerful they can freeze the air around them or even their foes blood.
The Deadaxe Orc tribe are mercenaries. The strongest of the Orcs are the leaders of these greedy evil mercenaries and get the highest pay and best loot from battles.

Death Worms come in many shapes, colours and sizes but all are deadly predators. Ganaroth Death Worms are toothless but can shoot out a violet stream of powerful acid that will burn right through all but the strongest of armor. Occasionally, one of these creatures will reach truly gargantuan proportions, posing a threat to all but the largest of prey creatures.
The Greater Magmasaur is, as you'd expect, an even larger version of the normal beast. It will attack and devour anything it comes across, even lesser Magmasaurs!

A gargantuan beast born from the filth and rot that accumulates beneath Appleseed Town. For years it has skulked unchallenged, reigning supreme in the rotten sewer network that leads off into the unexplored depths of Erildath's great subterra.

Due to the rotting state of the forest, plague has set in and creatures of the area that have not fled fast enough have succumbed to a violent disease known to survivors as Dark Rot. A large clan of Ogres travelling through the forest have caught this disease, which leaves its victims in a zombie-like state. The longer the Ogre has been infected the more hideous it becomes, and the more immune to pain it is as its brain and nerves stop functioning.

There is a small yet powerful army upon the islands. Their only purpose it to protect the island and its inhabitants from potential invaders. The army is renowned for its skill in utilising Elnorphants in war and its War Elnorphant rider are much feared.

The Yallagath Shroud Warlord runs this garrison like a well-oiled machine. This is reasonably easy with obedient Shroud troops but don't let that make you underestimate them. These creatures are potent and forceful examples of the Shadow Lord's forces.
In this clear area, a Colossal Vorgid has grown and is protecting its territory aggressively.

Pirate Queen Sara rules over the pirate gangs of the Kalax Coast with an iron fist. She takes a cut of all pirate's swag and none resist this any more. Those who used to mete a grisly end as Sara is a great warrior and decidedly vengeful! She ought to be treated with respect or, better yet, avoided altogether!

A giant undead fish that lurks in the frigid waters of the Bone Loch. Every year, the friendly skeletons of the nearby Rattling Spines catch one of these monstrous creatures to serve as the centerpiece of their festive table.

The Elephus Bahamut is a giant species of man-eating fish that has a long trunk atop its fanged mouth. These strange-looking creatures are covered in horny scales that are stronger than steel and are said to make fine armor for those who can get them. They use their trunk to grasp prey from the shore or boats and once caught in their grasp there is no chance of escape.

A horrid depiction of Another Hell, brought to life by the painter's anger and the Cursed Bard's song. These are the personal hells of the human mind, all different, all terrible, down to the finest stroke. Suffused with blood, the canvas melts and screams, turning everything around into a hellscape befitting its composition.
Green Bakab have served as powerful protectors of the ritual, ensuring none disrupt their Yellow brethren as they prepare to exalt their lord.

The Burned Man was once a normal man, however an accident occurred in the caverns that left it burned and on the brink of death. It feared death and with its last breath sold its soul to the dark powers. Now a powerful demon with nothing of its former self remaining within the scarred and burned-out body except pure evil and hate.

The Malogre are a race of turtle like beings that lived the slow life upon the marsh. Then plague came and turned the marsh poisonous and deadly. The Malogre who lived here succumbed to it, turning into the undead. The Shroud Wreathed Malogre has had his soul burned out by the baleful energies of the Shroud.

Yeti are huge bad tempered beasts and their Shaman are so foul tempered that they are generally exiled from Yeti community. In the Wilderness these angry beasts use their ability's to create magical ice crystals that are used in rituals to the Yeti Ice God Faryl who will send powerful ice storms and blizzards to freeze to death any who dare offend the Shaman.

Hypeezles are large weasel type creatures that live deep in the forest. Hypeezles are noted for their insane savagery in a fight and refusal to back down from even the most suicidal conflict. The Brood Mother is as frenzied as her litter spawn. She fights in a flurry of bites and claws, with a speed that surprises, given her bloated body!

The caves here once were home to the now extinct Wyza. These Giant Cobra-like serpents were hunted into oblivion by the Slyvin as sacrifices to their great god Zaq. Now only the angry spirits of the Wyza exist. These Spirits are as much a threat to the Slyvin as they are to anyone else.

Motoroth is the king of the Doron Barbarians and carved out his kingdom in a decade long war against the Greenskins that infested this land. Although he is happy with his kingdom and gets his fair share of combat and ale he is tired of the unskilled opponents he fights on a daily basis and yearns to meet a warrior with the skill to match him in single combat or even beat him. Are you worthy of this contest of arms?

Swampthings are monstrously sized Swampmen, some the size of a hill and made up of mud, rotting plants and trees. These beings are incredibly old, and many are said to be sleeping in the fens, that is, until something disturbs their rest by walking over them! This annoys them much like a mosquito annoys a human, and they will quickly attempt to squash this pest!

Chill Bones is a vicious frost demon. It appears to be gathering demons and undead adventurers to its banner for an eventual invasion of the surface world. This is a plan that cannot come to fruition!

The Deep Coelacanth is a close relative to the Giant Coelacanth. It is a horrific giant fish from the deepest area of the sea; however, like its cousin, it can survive for some time on land. The Deep Coelacanth can use its fins like legs to push its scaly body over the ice to catch slow-moving prey before returning to the darkness to digest its meal.

The Grumpy Orange Tree Treant is the guardian of this orange grove. He used to be happier, but people just kept taking the oranges of the grove without asking. Gosh, that makes him a Grumpy Orange Tree Treant!
